00001 ######################################################################
00002 # Name:    tkedat.tcl
00003 # Author:  Trevor Williams  (trevorw@sgi.com)
00004 # Date:    08/08/2013
00005 # Brief:   Namespace for reading .tkedat files.
00006 ######################################################################
00007 
00008 namespace eval tkedat {
00009 
00010   source [file join $::tke_dir lib ns.tcl]
00011 
00012   variable bcount 0
00013 
00014   ######################################################################
00015   # Counts the number of curly brackets found in the given string.
00016   proc bracket_count {line line_num start_col} {
00017 
00018     variable bcount
00019 
00020     while {[regexp -indices -start $start_col {([\{\}])(.*)$} $line -> char]} {
00021       if {[string index $line [lindex $char 0]] eq "\{"} {
00022         incr bcount
00023       } else {
00024         if {$bcount == 0} {
00025           return -code error "Bad tkedat format (line: $line_num, col: [lindex $char 0])"
00026         }
00027         incr bcount -1
00028       }
00029       set start_col [expr [lindex $char 0] + 1]
00030     }
00031 
00032     return $bcount
00033 
00034   }
00035 
00036   ######################################################################
00037   # Reads the given tkedat file, stripping/storing comments and verifying
00038   # that no Tcl commands are called.
00039   proc read {fname {include_comments 1}} {
00040 
00041     array set contents [list]
00042 
00043     if {![catch { open $fname r } rc]} {
00044 
00045       set comments [list]
00046       set value_ip 0
00047       set linenum  1
00048 
00049       foreach line [split [::read $rc] \n] {
00050 
00051         if {!$value_ip && [regexp {^\s*#(.*)$} $line -> comment]} {
00052 
00053           lappend comments $comment
00054 
00055         } elseif {!$value_ip && [regexp -indices {^\s*(\{[^\}]*\}|\S+)\s+(\{.*)$} $line -> key value]} {
00056 
00057           set key [string map {\{ {} \} {}} [string range $line {*}$key]]
00058 
00059           if {[bracket_count $line $linenum [lindex $value 0]] == 0} {
00060             set contents($key) [string range [string trim [string range $line {*}$value]] 1 end-1]
00061             if {[regexp {\[.*\]} $contents($key)]} {
00062               unset contents($key)
00063             } elseif {$include_comments} {
00064               set contents($key,comment) $comments
00065             }
00066             set comments [list]
00067           } else {
00068             set contents($key) [string range [string range $line {*}$value] 1 end]
00069             set value_ip 1
00070           }
00071 
00072         } elseif {!$value_ip && [regexp {^\s*(\{[^\}]*\}|\S+)\s+(\S+)$} $line -> key value]} {
00073 
00074           set key [string map {\{ {} \} {}} $key]
00075           set contents($key) [string trim $value]
00076 
00077           if {[regexp {\[.*\]} $contents($key)]} {
00078             unset contents($key)
00079           } elseif {$include_comments} {
00080             set contents($key,comment) $comments
00081           }
00082           set comments [list]
00083 
00084         } elseif {$value_ip} {
00085 
00086           if {[bracket_count $line $linenum 0] == 0} {
00087             append contents($key) " [string range [string trim $line] 0 end-1]"
00088             if {[regexp {\[.*\]} $contents($key)]} {
00089               unset contents($key)
00090             } elseif {$include_comments} {
00091               set contents($key,comment) $comments
00092             }
00093             set comments [list]
00094             set value_ip 0
00095           } else {
00096             if {$include_comments} {
00097               append contents($key) "$line\n"
00098             } else {
00099               append contents($key) " [string trim $line]"
00100             }
00101           }
00102 
00103         }
00104 
00105         incr linenum
00106 
00107       }
00108 
00109       close $rc
00110 
00111     } else {
00112 
00113       return -code error [msgcat::mc "Unable to open %s for reading" $fname]
00114 
00115     }
00116 
00117     return [array get contents]
00118 
00119   }
00120 
00121   ######################################################################
00122   # Writes the given array to the given tkedat file, adding the comments
00123   # back to the file.
00124   proc write {fname contents} {
00125 
00126     if {![catch { open $fname w } rc]} {
00127 
00128       array set content $contents
00129 
00130       foreach name [lsort [array names content]] {
00131         if {![regexp {,comment$} $name]} {
00132           if {[info exists content($name,comment)]} {
00133             foreach comment $content($name,comment) {
00134               puts $rc "#$comment"
00135             }
00136           }
00137           puts $rc "\n{$name} {$content($name)}\n"
00138         }
00139       }
00140 
00141       close $rc
00142 
00143     } else {
00144 
00145       return -code error [msgcat::mc "Unable to open %s for writing" $fname]
00146 
00147     }
00148 
00149   }
00150 
00151 }
